mapper.select: select distinct res.resource_key from t_resource res join t_role_resource rr on rr.resource_id=res.id join t_user_role ur on ur.role_id=rr.role_id and ur.user_id=#{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
select distinct res.name from t_resource res join t_role_resource rr on rr.resource_id=res.id join t_user_role ur on ur.role_id=rr.id and ur.user_id=#{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}

SELECT DISTINCT res.id AS id, res.NAME, res.parent_id, res.configure, res.type, res.sort, res.creator_id, res.creator, res.reviser_id, res.reviser, res.create_time, res.update_time, (select count(0) from t_role_resource where resource_id= res.id and role_id=#{roleId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}) as used FROM t_resource res left JOIN t_role_resource rr ON rr.resource_id = res.id left JOIN t_user_role ur ON ur.role_id = rr.role_id

SELECT m1.id AS id, ( CASE WHEN (m2.id = 0 OR m2.id IS NULL) THEN 0 ELSE m2.id END ) AS pId, m1. NAME AS NAME, ( CASE WHEN (m2.id = 0 OR m2.id IS NULL) THEN 'true' ELSE 'false' END ) as 'open' FROM t_resource m1 LEFT join t_resource m2 ON m1.PARENT_ID = m2.ID ORDER BY m1.id ASC

select distinct res.id as id,res.name,res.parent_id,res.configure,res.type,res.sort,res.creator_id,res.creator,res.reviser_id,res.reviser,res.create_time,res.update_time from t_resource res join t_role_resource rr on rr.resource_id=res.id join t_user_role ur on ur.role_id=rr.role_id and TYPE=1
